title: Lockdown Fish and Chips
text:
Thank you all for great, fresh fish and chips. Super piece of cod, nice and thick, cooked with light batter and served with minty mushy peas and tartare sauce.

We'll be back

Definitely recommend

title: Business trip
text:
Used the Doubletree as a venus for a meeting, the personalised service was excellent. The facilities were spotless and equipment provided new and simple to connect to.
Lunch was simple, but hot and tasty

Good value for money in the centre of York and easily accessible - 15 minutes walk from the station.

title: Enjoyable lunch
text:
Met some friends in this pub in the centre of Ely, what a joy...
Menu varied, food hot and tasty and good price. Staff were attentive and helpful.
I had the scallops to start which were cooked perfectly, the presentation was definitely a high point and gastropub describes this pub well.

Food fresh and therefore a little slow, but not a concern.

will definitely return

title: Poopped in for lunch
text: Visited the hardware store on the other side of the road to EmZo's and noticed a food sign, had a lovely, freshly made sandwich that was good value and good quality. Really enjoyed the food and the staff are great

title: Great food, great value for money
text:
Ate at The Bell on Friday night, good menu serving locally sourced ingredients. The menu had good choices and suitable for just about anyone.
Jordan was very attentive and went the extra mile to inform us where the ingredients came from. Food came out of the kitchen at a good pace and was hot and tasty.
The Seafood starter was plentiful and full of flavour, steak cooked to perfection and locally sourced cheeses finished off the meal.
Lively atmosphere that added to the experince.
Ate there with friends, who thoroughly enjoyed the food too and will definitely be returning

title: Unbelievable
text:
It's not often that I am stuck for words but the Acropolis did this to me.
You simply have to go and experience the feeling, even in poor weather the visit was fantastic

title: Quick lunch
text: Popped in for a quick lunch and was surprised by the experience, friendly staff, good price, quick service and tasty food. I had a burger that was fresh and cooked to perfection, my wife had the artisan fish finger sandwich. Lots of cakes on offer but resisted but did notice a couple next to us who had cake and they were generous portions.

title: Birthday meal for my Brother
text:
Arrived early and was seated by the friendly staff, as we were quite early they brought as a couple of tasters - a nice touch (and very tasty)
Food was fresh, hot and plentiful, I think I have a big appetite but they filled me up.
Crepe suzette, not really Indian, cooked at the table was impressive and very tasty. On the pricey side but worth it and we did have three courses

Thanks to all at Haveli - we will be back

title: Family birthday meal
text: Food good, set price and decent value. Service good and atmosphere pleasant. We were able to have a table for 12 which was appreciated.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text:
Wasn't 100% sure about booking the Castle View but went with it, great reception from the team there and the food was very tasty and plentiful
Nine of us attended and had a variety of currys from mild to hot, everyone commented that the quality was great.
At the end of the evening was pleasantly surprised by the bill as was great value - would recommend a visit

title: Good food, good service
text: Enjoyed the food, service was good and staff friendly. Good atmosphere and many Gins to taste, shame I was driving...

title: Lunch with friends
text: 15 of us turned up for lunch in May, the team were able to fit us in with short notice making us feel very welcome. Good fresh local food (I had Cromer Crab) a new good value for money

title: Sunday Lunch
text:
Had Sunday Lunch at the Gray Ox. My Father in Law used to drink here as a boy and the last time he visited was 1944 - it had changed a bit.
The three course set Sunday Lunch menu had a variety of choices that would suit all, the normal menu was also packed with good comfort food staples. My Father in law saw the Fish and Chips and was very pleased with his choice.
My wife and I had the Roast Beef
that was cooked pink and was very succulent, the Yorkshire puddings did Yorkshire proud :-)
The service from the kitchen was fast and the food tasty, of particular note was the staff who were friendly and helpful, the pub was busy (we sat down at 2pm) but was quietening down around this time - so a good time to visit.
We really enjoyed the food and the service - a good choice for Sunday Lunch.
Thank you

title: The art of good service
text:
Really enjoyed our stay, on an autumn saver. this included afternoon tea, 5 course taster menu, room and breakfast.
Room was beautiful, bed massive and extremely comfortable. Fridge stocked with complementary goodies and bath and shower super.
As a Michelin starred restaurant the food was varied and exquisite, with little tasters in between courses that added to the taste and experience.
The servers were spot on and were fully clued up on the food, its origin and the way it was cooked, our Sommelier knew his stuff and we enjoyed chatting about the wines.
A gift of creams were on the bed after our taster menu that finished the day off.
Breakfast was a joy and we were sad to leave.
Thank you

title: Quick lunch
text: Four of us popped in for a quick lunch, food was delivered quickly and was tasty. Great place for a snack

title: Great Evening Meal
text: Our favourite restaurant, the atmosphere is second to none, the food is delicious the service excellent and the price affordable, get in if you can.

title: Walking the Wall
text: A must do, only £5 per person with audio guide. Great descriptions of the 1,000 years of history and great views on the Lincolnshire countryside. A must do if you visit Lincoln

title: Surprised visitor
text:
Really impressed with the day. I was a reluctant visitor as have watched, and enjoyed all the films. I didnt expect to be surprised by the exhibits, especially the level of detail required to produce a film of this type.

As a top tip I would suggest taking your own food as it was a bit basic and pricey

its not a place i would revisit but glad i went
place: Warner Bros. Studio Tour London - The Making of Harry Potter

title: Great food, great surroundings, great service
text:
On holiday in Porthcothan for a week with my wife and her parents, booked into The seafood Restaurant for my wifes birthday. A little daunted by the price but the food was absolutely excellent. The winter three course menu at £31 is excellent value and has a great choice. This is one of the best experiences i have had in a restaurant.

Give it a try

Thank you

title: Business trip
text: Stayed at the Fox instead of the Angel, room fantastic, food excellent, great price and fantastic service. The evening was made special as Sarah and Darren were able to add that "extra something" that sets the tone that makes the difference between good and great. Highly recommend.
